p: Viremia (infectious virus) was detected in 50% of AGMs ( Fig 2) ranging from 4 to 7 DPI (viremia mean duration: 3.5 d), with a mean peak titer of 3.8 log 10 PFU/mL. vRNA was detected in the blood of viremic AGMs ranging from 4 to 9 DPI (mean duration 4.5 d) ( Fig 2), with a mean peak vRNA load of 6.9 log 10 c/mL. AGM10 displayed the highest detectable viremia and vRNA load in the blood at 7 DPI, reaching a titer of 4.1 log 10 PFU/mL and a vRNA load of 7.2 log 10 c/mL. vRNA was detected in the oral swabs from AGM10 at 6 DPI and AGM12 at 7 DPI ( Fig 2), with a mean peak vRNA load of 4.5 log 10 c/mL. Infectious virus was detected in AGM10s oral swab at 6 DPI (1.3 log 10 PFU/mL). AGM10 had prolonged vRNA and infectious virus detected in vaginal swabs from 5 to 21 DPI ( Fig 2), with a peak vRNA load of 7.5 log 10 c/mL and a titer of 3.8 log 10 PFU/mL at 7 DPI. By 15 DPI, all AGMs with detectable viremia seroconverted ( Table 5).
